result.execSummary:
The defendant Mandi N. Wentland was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Waushara County Case No. 13CF82

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. The defendant is prohibited from being on the premises of any pawn shops or participating in any pawning activity.
DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.  Defendant is ordered to participate and successfully complete the Waushara County TAD/Safe Streets Program.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mandi N. Wentland

records.addlTxt:
13CF82, 13CM234 & 14CF126 Cases called @ 11:19 a.m. Defendant Mandi N. Wentland in court with attorney Chelsie Ann Thuecks.  Defendant Mandi N. Wentland in custody.  Steven Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  14CF126 - The court entertains waiver of the preliminary hearing. The court accepts voluntary waiver of the preliminary hearing. Defendant bound over for trial. Information filed by ADA Anderson. Receipt admitted - Reading waived. Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed. 13CF82 - Upon motion of the State the Court amends Ct 1 to Misdemeanor Theft contrary to Wis Stat 943.20(1)(a).   Plea: 13CF82 - NC. 14CF126 - NC.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. 13CM234 - DRI.  Statement by DE. 

Court orders: 13CF82 - 6 mos WCJ - Huber, GT, 89 days CFTS - I/S - 1 year probation - Conditions: Defendant is ordered to enroll in and maintain participation in the Waushara County TAD/Safe Streets Program, defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician, AODA and follow through, defendant is prohibited from being on the premises of any pawn shops or participating in any pawning, $385 Rest to EZ Pawn, $110 Rest to Rick's Olde Gold, $500 Rest to P.M., costs w/ 60 DTP or PP, Atty Fees w/ 60 DTP or PP.

14CF126 - S/W - 3 yrs probation - Concurrent with 13CF82 - Conditions: Defendant is ordered to participate and successfully complete in the Waushara County TAD/Safe Streets Program, defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician, AODA and follow through, defendant is prohibited from being on the premises of any pawn shops or participating in any pawning, $385 Rest to EZ Pawn, $110 Rest to Rick's Olde Gold, $500 Rest to P.M., Costs w/ 60 DTP or PP, DNA sample and surcharge, Atty fees w/ 60 DTP or PP. Appeal rights given.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 17, 2014 at 11:15 am.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Plea & Sentencing Hearing on October 3, 2014 at 10:30 am

13CF82, 13CM234 & 14CF126 2:58 pm cases called. Defendant Mandi N. Wentland in court with attorney Chelsie Ann Thuecks.  Defendant Mandi N. Wentland in custody.  Steven P. Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Personal appearance addressed with defendant.   14CF126-Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading waived.  Preliminary hearing and time limits discussed. Court questions defendant-waives time limits to preliminary hearing. Court accepts waiver of time limits. Statement by ADA Anderson-resolution reached-requests adjourned plea & sentencing date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 3, 2014 at 10:30 am.
Initial appearance on September 17, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

13CF82, 13CM234 & 14CF126 Cases called @ 3:36 p.m. Defendant Mandi N. Wentland in court.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is requesting to proceed without an attorney and speak with the DA regarding the matters. Statement by DA Blader regarding the defendant proceeding without counsel. The court discusses the counsel issue with the defendant. The court will appoint an attorney forthwith without the defendant being required to make a deposit.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 17, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
